III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth;
Section reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination
Description of restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender physical condition, medical
condition psychiatric condition, and personal history,
including any history of trauma, and must be done in a
manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 06/30/2025, a youth was found covered in dried blood
and scratches on their arms. A staff member scratched the
youth's arms and told the youth to leave the facility. The
youth punched himself in the face a couple of times, causing
a nosebleed. The youth went AWOL. The youth sought help
from a nearby DHHS building. Law enforcement located the
youth and the youth was taken to the hospital. The staff
member that scratched the youth accompanied the youth to
the hospital.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was contacted on 07/01/2025 by email.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another Department of Health and Human
Service (DHHS) Worker. Youth A was observed with 2 small,
circular scabs on his left forearm and one small, circular scab
on his right forearm. Youth A stated the scabs were from
scratching the mosquito bites on his arms. Youth A was
observed without scratch marks on either arm. Youth A was
asked if he recently had scratches on his arms. Youth A
stated he did have scratch marks on his arms but they faded
and he did not want to talk about it. Youth A was asked about
his relationship with Supervisor. Youth A stated Supervisor is
“nice and helpful” and denied being restrained by Supervisor.
Youth A was asked if he recently experienced a bloody nose.
Youth A stated he punched his own nose four times with his
fist because he was angry. Youth A stated he did not want to
talk about being angry or the incident. Youth A denied Christ
Child House staff telling him to leave the facility. Youth A
2

stated he has chosen to leave Christ Child House on his own
without permission. Youth A stated he feels safe at Christ
Child House. Supervisor and Youth A’s interactions were
observed to be friendly and comfortable as they engaged in
conversation prior to the start of this interview.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another DHHS Worker. Youth B stated
Supervisor and Workforce Development and Human
Resource Director (WDHRD) redirected Youth A and Youth B
to go inside for reflection time but they refused and remained
on the playground. Youth B stated Supervisor and WDHRD
walked Youth A inside and to the medical room after Youth A
threw woodchips at one of them. Youth B stated Youth A was
angry and he heard Youth A kick and throw things in the
medical room. Youth B stated he was in the supervisor office
with a staff (does not recall who) and saw Supervisor and
WDHRD try to restrain Youth A on the video camera monitor.
Youth B stated he later saw Youth A in the back of a police
car and told Youth A was going to the hospital.
Workforce Development and Human Resource Director
(WDHRD) was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another DHHS Worker. WDHRD stated
Supervisor was on the playground monitoring Youth A and
Youth B, who did not have permission to be outside. WDHRD
stated Youth A and Youth B climbed to the top of the
playscape and Youth A became upset when Youth B agreed
to go inside and talk with WDHRD. WDHRD stated Youth A
came down from the playscape and started to hit
Supervisor’s arm. WDHRD stated Supervisor verbally
redirected Youth A to stop. WDHRD stated she and
Supervisor escorted Youth A inside to the medical office to
ensure de-escalation. WDHRD stated Youth A immediately
began to destroy the medical office by tipping over the water
cooler and height and weight scale and throwing folders and
a phone. WDHRD stated Staff 1 entered the medical room
and assisted WDHRD and Supervisor move items out of the
medical office. WDHRD stated she and Supervisor placed
Youth A in a standing two-person hold when Youth A
became aggressive towards Supervisor by trying to bite her
arm and breast. WDHRD stated Youth A pulled himself to a
seated position on the ground and was released from their
hold. WDHRD stated Youth A secured one of Supervisor’s
acrylic nails during physical management and used it to
scratch his forearm. WDHRD stated Youth A said “Gonna
3

tell. They scratch me. I don’t want to see my brother and
family.” WDHRD stated she listened and told Youth A that he
did not have to visit his brother or pre-adoptive family.
WDHRD stated Youth A punched himself in the nose and
gave himself a nosebleed. WDHRD stated Staff 1 gave
Youth A some paper towels, but Youth A threw the paper
towel on the ground and smeared blood on to his arms and
legs. WDHRD stated Youth A still sat on the ground when
she left the medical room to assist with the arriving
volunteers. WDHRD stated in hindsight the medical room
was not an ideal area to work with Youth A due to the
numerous objects in the room.
Supervisor was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor stated Youth
A started to yell that he was going outside to truant and told
Youth B to join him outside at the start of reflection time.
Supervisor stated she followed Youth A and Youth B outside
and Youth B sat down on the swing and started to swing
while Youth A tried to touch Youth B’s feet, legs and
buttocks. Supervisor stated WDHRD came outside and
redirected Youth A to talk with her, but he refused.
Supervisor stated Youth A and Youth B moved to the landing
at the top of the play structure slide. Supervisor stated
WDHRD then asked Youth B to come down and talk with her.
Supervisor stated Youth B agreed, which caused Youth A to
say he was coming down to talk with WDHRD. Supervisor
stated Youth A and Youth B came down from the play
structure and started to walk towards the facility and then
Youth A started to hit Supervisor’s arm and chest. Supervisor
stated she and WHDRD verbally redirected and escorted
Youth A inside to the medical room. Supervisor stated Youth
A began to throw items in the medical room before calming
down in a standing two-person hold. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A kicked and bit her right upper chest area while in the
two-person hold. Supervisor stated Youth A was released
when he sat on the ground and punched his nose twice and
wiped the blood from his nose on to his face and arms.
Supervisor stated Youth A obtained two of her acrylic nails
during this incident and he used her acrylic nails to scratch
himself on his arms while venting about not wanting to visit
his brother. Supervisor stated WDHRD left the medical room
to facilitate a visit and Youth A remained with Supervisor and
Staff 1. Supervisor stated Youth A got up and walked out of
the medical room minutes later and walked to the DHHS
office next door. Supervisor stated Youth A did not respond
4

to Staff 1’s verbal redirection and shadowing. Supervisor
stated she saw Youth A enter the DHHS office and called law
enforcement. Supervisor stated another staff was assigned to
accompany Youth A to the hospital with law enforcement.
Supervisor stated she never directed Youth A to leave Christ
Child House. Supervisor was observed with two missing
acrylic nails.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child House
with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated Youth A said, “You
ready? 1, 2, 3 Let’s AWOL” to Youth B and they went outside
with Supervisor following them. Staff 1 stated she went
outside when the other staff and youth were situated for
reflection time and saw Youth A trying to bite and slap
Supervisor’s arm. Staff 1 stated WDHRD was also outside
and tried to intervene as Supervisor waved her arms away
from Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A laughed as he was
escorted back inside by Supervisor and WDHRD and she
took Youth B inside. Staff 1 stated she tried to verbally de-
escalate Youth A when she entered the medical room by
asking “What can we do to help? What’s wrong?” as Youth A
tried to hit and bite Supervisor. Staff 1 stated Youth A said,
“Shut the fuck up” and continued to throw items in the room.
Staff 1 stated she helped Supervisor and WDHRD pick up
and remove items for safety. Staff 1 stated Supervisor and
WDHRD placed Youth A in a two-person standing hold, but
Youth A kicked and bit Supervisor. Staff 1 stated Youth A sat
down on the ground when he was released. Staff 1 stated
Youth A hit his nose until it bled and wiped the blood on his
arms. Staff 1 stated Youth A vented and said he never
wanted to see his brother and his brother did not care about
him. Youth A also stated he was going to the DHHS agency
next door to tell them that Christ Child House was hurting
him. Staff 1 stated WDHRD left the medical room and shortly
after she and Supervisor followed Youth A outside. Staff 1
stated Youth A jumped over the fence and went to the DHHS
office. Staff 1 stated law enforcement was notified that Youth
A was at the DHHS office.
Video
06/30/2025 video footage was reviewed. Video shows Youth
A walking between Supervisor and WDHRD with his arms
loosely held into the medical room. Upon entering the
medical room Youth A begins to throw objects. Youth A
knocks over and kicks the water cooler, tips over the height
and weight scale, flips over a chair, knocks over a fan and
5

then picks up and throws the base of the fan, and throws
other objects from the counter. Staff 1 enters the medical
room and assists Supervisor and WDHRD pick up items from
the ground and remove them from the medical room. Youth A
hits and holds Supervisor’s left arm with his head bent down.
Supervisor and WDHRD secure Youth A in a two-person
standing hold in front of a counter. Youth A’s head is turned
towards Supervisor’s right upper arm and right upper chest
area. Youth A kicks at Supervisor and WDHRD. Youth A
pulls himself toward the ground and is released. Youth A
touches his forearms back and forth. Youth A hits the front of
his head. Youth A wipes blood onto his legs. WDHRD leaves
the medical room. Youth A lays on the ground while
Supervisor and Staff 1 watch him. Youth A gets up and
leaves the medical room. Video footage does not have
sound.
Documentation Reviewed
WDHRD wrote an incident report that coincides with her
interview.
Christ Child House’s Discipline and Behavior Management
Policy states Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) Non-Violent
Crisis Interventions, includes verbal techniques for the
purpose of crisis prevention, de-escalation, and safe
management of resident.
WDHRD completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training for instructors on 08/15/2024. WDHRD
does not have a discipline history.
Supervisor completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training on 01/31/2025. Supervisor’s discipline
history includes: Verbal discipline on 06/05/2025 for changing
the scheduled activity from skating to a movie. Written
discipline on 11/07/2023 for not redirecting a prone restraint
of a youth on 11/06/2023.
Staff 1 completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training on 11/26/2024. Staff 1’s discipline
history includes: Verbal discipline on 07/02/2025 for lifting a
youth’s feet off the ground while in a standing two-person
standing hold. (See additional findings in this investigation.)
Verbal discipline on 03/09/2025 for not complying with a
directive to discontinue a dialogue with a youth. Written
6

discipline on 12/18/2025 for cell phone use while working
with youths.
Tour of incident area
The play structure is located in Christ Child House’s
backyard. There is a side door that leads from the back yard
directly to the youth common area. The medical room is to
the right and the supervisor’s office is to the left of the
common area.
Additional Findings
Interviews
Workforce Development and Human Resource Director
(WDHRD) was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another DHHS Worker. WDHRD stated she is
Christ Child House’s trainer for Crisis Prevention Institute –
Nonviolent Crisis Prevention Intervention. WDHRD stated
Staff 1 held and lifted Youth A’s feet off the ground when
Youth A was kicking WDHRD and Supervisor in a two-person
standing hold. WDHRD stated Staff 1 immediately released
Youth A’s legs when directed by WDHRD. WDHRD stated
Staff 1 received written discipline for her actions.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child House
with another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 did not state in her
interview that she raised Youth A’s feet off the ground.
Supervisor was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ Child
House with another DHHS Worker. Supervisor did not state
in her interview that she pushed Youth A’s head in this
incident.
Video
06/30/2025 video review shows Supervisor and WDHRD
secure Youth A in two-person standing hold in front of a
counter in the medical room. Youth A kicks repeatedly at
Supervisor and WDHRD. Staff 1 faces Youth A, WDHRD,
and Supervisor and places her hands around Youth A’s legs
and Youth A’s feet are off the ground. Staff 1 releases and
Youth A’s feet are back on the ground. Youth A turns his
head towards Supervisor’s right upper arm and chest area
multiple times. Supervisor places a hand on top of and
behind Youth A’s head and pushes Youth A’s head down and
away from her. Video camera angle does not capture if Youth
A makes contact and bites Supervisor’s right upper arm and
chest area. Video does not have sound.
7

Documentation Reviewed
WDHRD wrote an incident report that coincides with her
interview.
Supervisor completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training on 01/31/2025. Supervisor does not
have discipline history with CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention
standards and prohibitions (1)(a)(ii).
Staff 1 completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training on 11/26/2024. Staff 1 has discipline
history with CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and
prohibitions (1)(a)(ii). Staff 1 received verbal discipline on
07/02/2025 when she lifted Youth A’s feet off the ground
while Youth A was in a standing two-person hold on
06/30/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for not scratching Youth
A’s arms. Supervisor stated Youth A secured two of her
acrylic nails and used them to scratch his own arms on
06/30/2025. WDHRD supported Supervisor’s account. Youth
A was observed without scratch marks on 07/02/2025 on his
arms.
Additional Findings
The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 held and
pulled Youth A’s feet up off the ground when he was kicking
in a standing person two-person hold done by Supervisor
and WDHRD. Staff 1’s actions were collaborated by
WDHRD’s interview and video review.
The agency is also found in noncompliance when Supervisor
pushed the top and back of Youth A’s head down and away
from her when Youth A tried to bite her right upper arm and
chest area while he was in a standing two-person hold done
by Supervisor and WDHRD as seen in the video review.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
